subject: 6p 530 Update: Spacewalk on track
body:
6p 530 Update: Spacewalk on track



=================================

CBS NEWS Coverage of Breaking Space News
Posted: 5:58 PM, 5/30/07

By William Harwood
CBS News Space Consultant

Changes and additions:

   05/03/07 (01:00 PM): Schirra dies
   05/25/07 (01:15 PM): Oefelein leaving NASA, agency confirms
   05/30/07 (03:10 PM): Spacewalk begins
   05/30/07 (05:58 PM): Debris panels moved; antenna work on tap

=================================

5:58 PM, 5/30/07, Update: Debris panels moved; antenna work on tap

Space station commander Fyodor Yurchikhin and flight engineer Oleg Kotov are midway through a spacewalk to install micrometeoroid debris shields and re-route a Global Positioning System antenna cable. While the spacewalk began about 45 minutes late because of communications problems, the cosmonauts have made up lost time and flight controllers expect the excursion to end roughly on schedule, around 8:20 p.m.

The cosmonauts have retrieved the debris panels from their storage point on the Unity module and moved them to the front section of the Zvezda command module using a telescoping boom. Before installing the shields, however, the spacewalkers made their way to the back of the command module to reposition the GPS cable, part of a system that will provide navigation data to approaching unmanned European Space Agency cargo craft.

Once the cable work is complete, Yurchikhin and Kotov will install five of 17 debris panels before calling it a day and returning to the Pirs airlock module. The remaining 12 panels will be installed next week.
